article_text: Across the country, state legislatures have turned back efforts to repeal renewable energy mandates. But opponents in Topeka are inching closer to a repeal in a state where even Gov. Sam Brownback, a Republican, champions wind power. Twenty-nine states have renewable energy mandates on the books. Bills weakening or repealing the requirements came up in at least nine states this year, including Missouri and Kansas.

article_metadata.title: Green energy has been a political giant, but a threat looms in Kansas | The Kansas City Star

og.description: Green energy has been a political giant, but a threat looms in Kansas

article_summary:
Across the country, state legislatures have turned back efforts to repeal renewable energy mandates.
Twenty-nine states have renewable energy mandates on the books.
Bills weakening or repealing the requirements came up in at least nine states this year, including Missouri and Kansas.
But opponents in Topeka are inching closer to a repeal in a state where even Gov.
Sam Brownback, a Republican, champions wind power.
